Package org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.gallery

Class DefaultGalleryGroupRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.gallery.AbstractGalleryGroupRenderer
      • org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.gallery.AbstractGridGroupRenderer
        • org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.gallery.DefaultGalleryGroupRenderer

  • public class DefaultGalleryGroupRenderer
extends AbstractGridGroupRenderer

    Default group renderer used by the Gallery widget. Supports multi-line text, images, animation and several other features.

    NOTE: THIS WIDGET AND ITS API ARE STILL UNDER DEVELOPMENT.

    Author:
    Nicolas Richeton (nicolas.richeton@gmail.com)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.gallery.AbstractGridGroupRenderer

        H_COUNT, V_COUNT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DefaultGalleryGroupRenderer​()
      This group renderer draws a title line, then items in a grid layout.

      • layout

        public void layout​(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc,
                   GalleryItem group)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGalleryGroupRenderer
        This method is called on each root item when the Gallery changes (resize, item addition or removal) in order to update the gallery size. The implementation must update the item internal size (px) using setGroupSize(item, size); before returning.
        Overrides:
        layout in class AbstractGridGroupRenderer

      • preDraw

        public void preDraw​(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGalleryGroupRenderer
        This method is called before drawing the first item. It can be used to calculate some values (like font metrics) that will be used for each item.
        Overrides:
        preDraw in class AbstractGalleryGroupRenderer

      • mouseDown

        public boolean mouseDown​(GalleryItem group,
                         org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e,
                         org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point coords)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGalleryGroupRenderer
        This method can be implemented to handle mouse down events at the group level. Usually to interact with custom group UI.
        Overrides:
        mouseDown in class AbstractGridGroupRenderer
        Parameters:
        group - The group on which the mouse click occured
        e - The original mouse event
        coords - The pointer coordinates relative to the group
        Returns:
        false if event was handled by the group renderer and Gallery should not try to handle this event as a click on a GalleryItem.

      • setFillIfSingleColumn

        public void setFillIfSingleColumn​(boolean fillIfSingle)

        Experimental feature.

        If set to true, this will enable a special behavior when the items are so large that only one can fit in the client area. In this case, items are always resized and centered to fit best in the client area.

        See bug 266613 : https://bugs.eclipse.org/266613

        Parameters:
        fillIfSingle -
